content.question: Suppose the consumer price index <math alttext="open parenthesis, C P I, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>CPI</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was 100 on January 1st, 2017 and 110 on January 1st, 2018 with no changes in nominal wages. Which of the following is definitely true about the economy between January of 2017 and January of 2018?

choices.label: The inflation rate was <math alttext="negative 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> percent.
Nominal <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> decreased by 10 percent.

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
